intro: Phacelia cicutaria, commonly known as blue phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Phacelia cicutaria is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
